edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp

Class Briefcase

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.Briefcase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Briefcase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Briefcase class represents the briefcase that the player is searching for. All of the fields used represent the random location of the briefcase in the grid.
    Author:
    PinkPanthers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int c
      This field assigns the briefcase's row coordinate.
      private int[] colArray
      This field represents the briefcase's possible column coordinates.
      private int colIdx
      This field randomly selects 0, 1, 2, which represent the integers 1, 4, and 7 in the array colArray.
      private int r
      This field represents the briefcase's row coordinate.
      (package private) java.util.Random rand 
      private int[] rowArray
      This field represents the briefcase's possible row coordinates.
      private int rowIdx
      This field randomly selects 0, 1, 2, which represent the integers 1, 4, and 7 in the array rowArray.

    • Field Detail

      • rand

        java.util.Random rand

      • rowArray

        private int[] rowArray
        This field represents the briefcase's possible row coordinates. The array provides all possible options. The value is randomly selected with rowIdx, and called in the constructor Briefcase().

      • rowIdx

        private int rowIdx
        This field randomly selects 0, 1, 2, which represent the integers 1, 4, and 7 in the array rowArray.

      • r

        private int r
        This field represents the briefcase's row coordinate. The array chooses which coordinate to use randomly selected by rowIdx for the rowArray.

      • colArray

        private int[] colArray
        This field represents the briefcase's possible column coordinates. The array provides all possible options. The value is randomly selected with colIdx, and called in the constructor Briefcase().

      • colIdx

        private int colIdx
        This field randomly selects 0, 1, 2, which represent the integers 1, 4, and 7 in the array colArray.

      • c

        private int c
        This field assigns the briefcase's row coordinate. The array chooses which coordinate to use, which is randomly selected by colIdx for the colArray.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Briefcase

        public Briefcase()
        The default constructor for the Briefcase class. It assigns values based on the random selection of the arrays, using all of the fields.

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomRow

        public int getRandomRow()
        This method is called in GameEngine for the Map to place the briefcase. It returns r which is the row where the Briefcase will be placed.
        Returns:
        r It returns the row.

      • getRandomCol

        public int getRandomCol()
        This method is called in the GameEngine for the Map to place the briefcase. It returns c which is the row where the Briefcase will be placed.
        Returns:
        c It returns the column.
